gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਮਾਤ ਪਿਤਾ ਕੇਰੀ ਸੇਵਾ ਸਰਵਨ ਕੀਨੀ ਸਿਖ ਬਿਰਲੋ ੲੀ ਗੁਰ ਸੇਵਾ ਠਹਰਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Maat Pitaa Kayree Sayvaa Saravan Keenee , Sikh Biralo Ee Gur Sayvaa Tthaharaavaee ?
translation: A rare disciple would stay and serve his Guru just as noble Sarvan served his blind parents so dedicatedly.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਲਛਮਨ ਰਘੁਪਤਿ ਭਾੲਿ ਭਗਤ ਮੈ ਕੋਟਿ ਮਧੇ ਕਾਹੂ ਗੁਰਭਾੲੀ ਬਨਿ ਅਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Lachhaman Raghoupati Bhaai Bhagat Mai , Koti Madhay Kaahoo Gurbhaaee Bani Aavaee ?
translation: Some rare devotee would serve his Guru with so much love and devotion with which Lachhman served his brother Ram.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਜਲ ਬਰਨ ਬਰਨ ਸਰਬੰਗ ਰੰਗ ਬਿਰਲੋ ਬਿਬੇਕੀ ਸਾਧ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਮਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Jal Baran Baran Sarabang Ranga , Biralo Bibaykee Saadh Sangati Samaavaee ?
translation: As water mixes with any colour to acquire the same hue; thus a rare Sikh contemplating and practising meditation merges into the holy gathering of Guru's devotees.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਸੰਧਿ ਮਿਲੇ ਬੀਸ ੲਿਕੀਸ ੲੀਸ ਪੂਰਨ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾ ਕੈ ਕਾਹੂ ਅਲਖ ਲਖਾਵੲੀ ॥੧੦੩॥
transliteration: Gur Sikh Sandhi Milay Bees Ikees Eesa , Pooran Kripaa Kai Kaahoo Alakh Lakhaavaee ?103?
translation: On meeting the Guru and receiving the blessings of initiation from him, a Sikh surely reaches and realises God to become one with Him. Thus a True Guru showers his beneficence on a rare Sikh and lifts him to the divine level of supreme consciousness. (103
